intro: Blepharodon tillettii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often with a rosette of leaves at the base. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Blepharodon tillettii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
